climbs.name: Route One
climbs.fa: Mark Powell, Beverly Powell, and Don Lauria

content.description:
This is an enjoyable route that is well protected by the Needles standards.  There are still a handful of runouts on easier rock. 

  Scramble up to gully and pull on to the rock from a large chockstone.  Angle up to the right and clip a fixed pin, which can be backed up with a large brass nut.  Climb the face to the left until you can join the arete and a nut placement (#10 HB).  Make a 5.10a move on the arete, even though the bolt tempts you to the right.  After the bolt, angle left to the arete and place a flared #1 camalot which can be backup up with a small ball nut. Clip the final bolt (crux) and angle right on easier rock to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection:
One set of Aliens (blue through red), nuts, #1 camalot, and optional ball nuts 

  Bring lots of long slings to reduce drag.
content.location: Start the route on top of the huge chockstone...

climbs.name: Heads you win
climbs.fa: Paul Muehl, Bob Archbold, and Jeff Muehl

content.description:
You may want your partner to win this coin flip.  The climbing is very continous and probably a "little" harder than the orginal 5.9 rating.  

  This bold climb starts on the west side of the rock.  Follow the NW corner passing two old pins and 2 new bolts near the top.  The boldest variation heads straight up the face, but the difficulties could be eased by following the chimney to the left for a while. Approaching the thin crack in the center of the face is stout and X rated if the pin fails.  The upper wall has better gear, but is very pumpy.
content.protection: Double set of aliens, nuts, and RP's.
content.location: The route follows the NW corner...

content.description: This phallic spire offers a couple good routes in the 5.10 range.  "Route One" is reasonably well protected for the needles area, while "Heads you wins" has some bold sections with pumpy climbing.
